intro: Mammillaria nejapensis var. typica, commonly known as the Nejapén White Globular Cactus, is a compact, globular cactus native to Mexico. It features a short, thick stem with a white to pale green coloration and is covered in white, woolly hairs. The plant produces small, white flowers during the spring and summer months. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-draining soil and full sun. Due to its unique appearance and compact size, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation.
